full_summary:
# Amended Government Tender Announcement for SIGMA Professional Services

### [English] 

### [French](#french) 

#### Tenders eligibility
Please be aware that the closing time for the submission of bids has been amended. All required supporting documents and bid submissions must be submitted by 14:00 EDT on June 10, 2024. Late submissions will be considered non-responsive.

#### Tender details 
Under this Request for Proposal (RFP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) seeks proposals for in-service support and managed services related to the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system SIGMA used by PWGSC and its client department Shared Services Canada (SSC). 

### Unsolicited Goods/Services Not Requested/ Required
At this time, no unsolicited goods/services are requested or required.

#### Regions 
This tender will be dealing with services across the National Capital Region (NCR).

### Relevant Procurement Process 
All applicants should ensure that their submissions adhere to the terms outlined in the eligibility criteria and procurement process as stated. 

### Points of contact 
If you are seeking further information, please contact:
Hicham Laassouli
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage  
City: Gatineau 
Province: Quebec  
Canada K1A 0S5  
Phone: Not Applicable  
Email: hicham.laassouli@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Links 
In order to access the solicitation further details, please visit:  
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19489282?extsite=MTk0ODkyODJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Note 
Please note that the technical specification, evaluation criteria and financial requirements for this RFP can be found within the solicitation document for the requested information.

Notes for response format: 
(1) Provide any necessary headings in English and French to indicate which version is next, 
(2) Render inline formatting in a regex-flavored markdown format to ensure these details are readily accessible and extracted in the final rendered output.  And (3) Be sure use inline coding specific tags for rendering French text sections, i.e.  `(#french)`below.  
```
Please see [above guidelines](https://gist.github.com/jjngomez/32ff8a4c2c30
